intro: Quinquina pubescens, commonly known as the hairy quinquina, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves. The plant produces small, white or yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a serrated margin. Quinquina pubescens is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and shrublands.
